arabicText: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَقَالَ تَمَتَّعُوا۟ فِى دَارِكُمْ ثَلَـٰثَةَ أَيَّامٍۢ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ وَعْدٌ غَيْرُ مَكْذُوبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
In	 response	 they	 hamstrung	 her,	 he	
therefore	said,	“Enjoy	a	further	three	days	
in	your	homes;	 this	is	a	promise	 that	will	
not	be	untrue.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 unhoñ	 ne	 us	 ki	 koocheñ	 kātiñ	 (pāoñ	
kāt	 diye)	 to	 Suāleh ne	 kahā	 apne	 gharoñ	
meiñ	 tin	 din	 aur	 barat	 lo	 (fāida	 uthā	 lo)	
yeh	w’adā	hai	ke	jhootā	na	hoga

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ أَمْرُنَا نَجَّيْنَا صَـٰلِحًۭا وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَعَهُۥ بِرَحْمَةٍۢ مِّنَّا وَمِنْ خِزْىِ يَوْمِئِذٍ ۗ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ ٱلْقَوِىُّ ٱلْعَزِيزُ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	when	Our	 command	 came,	We	
rescued	Saleh	and	the	Muslims	who	were	
with	 him	 by	 Our	 mercy,	 and	 from	 the	
disgrace	 of	 that	 day;	indeed	 your	 Lord	is	
the	Strong,	the	Almighty.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	hamārā	ḥukm	āyā	ham	ne	Suāleh
aur	 us	 ke	 sāth	 ke	 Musalmānoñ	 ko	 apni	
raḥmat	farmā	kar	bachā	liyā	aur us	din	ki	
ruswāi	 se	 be-shak	 tumhārā	 Rab	 qawi	
‘izzat		wāla	hai.

arabicText: وَأَخَذَ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ فِى دِيَـٰرِهِمْ جَـٰثِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 the	 terrible	scream	seized	 the	unjust	
- so	 at	 morning	 they	 remained	 lying	
flattened	in	their	homes.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 zālimoñ	 ko	 chingādh	 ne	 āa	 liya	 to	
subah	 apne	 gharoñ	 meiñ	 ghutnoñ	 ke	 bal	
pade	rah	gaye

arabicText: كَأَن لَّمْ يَغْنَوْا۟ فِيهَآ ۗ أَلَآ إِنَّ ثَمُودَا۟ كَفَرُوا۟ رَبَّهُمْ ۗ أَلَا بُعْدًۭا لِّثَمُودَ
englishTranslationText:
As	 if	 they	 had	 never	 lived	 there;	 indeed	
the	 tribe	 of	 Thamud	 disbelieved	 in	 their	
Lord;	away	with	the	Thamud!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Goyā	kabhi	yahāñ	base	hi	na	the	sun	lo	be-shak		Samood	apne	Rab	se	munkir	huye	arey	l’anat	
ho	Samood	par.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ جَآءَتْ رُسُلُنَآ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ بِٱلْبُشْرَىٰ قَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًۭا ۖ قَالَ سَلَـٰمٌۭ ۖ فَمَا لَبِثَ أَن جَآءَ بِعِجْلٍ حَنِيذٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 Our	 angels	 came	 to	 Ibrahim	 with	 glad	 tidings	- they	 said,	 “Peace”;	 he	 answered,	
“Peace”	and	without	delay	brought	a	roasted	calf.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	 be-shak	 hamāre	 Firishte	 Ibrāhim ke	 pās	 muzda	 lekar	 āaye	 bole	 salām,	 kahā	 salām	 phir	
kuchh		der	na	ki	ke	ek	bachdā	bhunā	le	āaye

arabicText: فَلَمَّا رَءَآ أَيْدِيَهُمْ لَا تَصِلُ إِلَيْهِ نَكِرَهُمْ وَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةًۭ ۚ قَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفْ إِنَّآ أُرْسِلْنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِ لُوطٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	 he	 saw	 their	 hands	 not	 reaching	 towards	it,	 he	 thought	 they	were	 pretending	and	
inwardly	started	fearing	them;	they	said,	“Do	not	be	afraid	- we	are	sent	to	the	people	of	Lut.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Phir	jab	dekhā	ke	un	ke	hāth	khāne	ki	taraf	nahiñ	pahuñchte	un	ko	ūpari	(ajnabi)	samjha	aur	jee	
hi	jee	meiñ	un	se	darne	lagā	bole	darye	nahiñ	ham	Qaum-e-Lūt		ki	taraf		bheje	gaye	haiñ

arabicText: وَٱمْرَأَتُهُۥ قَآئِمَةٌۭ فَضَحِكَتْ فَبَشَّرْنَـٰهَا بِإِسْحَـٰقَ وَمِن وَرَآءِ إِسْحَـٰقَ يَعْقُوبَ
englishTranslationText:
And	his	wife	was	standing	by	and	she	started	laughing,	so	We	gave	her	glad	tidings	regarding	
Ishaq,	and	following	Ishaq,	regarding	Yaqub.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ki	biwi	khadi	thi	woh	hañsne	lagi	to	ham	ne	usey	Ishāq ki	khush	khabri	di	aur	Ishāq	ke	
piche	Y’aqūb ki

arabicText: قَالَتْ يَـٰوَيْلَتَىٰٓ ءَأَلِدُ وَأَنَا۠ عَجُوزٌۭ وَهَـٰذَا بَعْلِى شَيْخًا ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَشَىْءٌ عَجِيبٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
She	 said,	 “Oh	 woe	 to	 me	 - will	 I	 bear	 a	
child	 whereas	 I	 am	 an	 old	 woman,	 and	
this	 my	 husband,	 is	 an	 old	 man?	 This	 is	
something	really	extraordinary.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Boli	hāye	kharābi	kya	mere	bachchā	hoga	
aur	 maiñ	 boodhi	 aur	 yeh	 haiñ	 mere	
shauhar	boodhe	be-shak	yeh	to	achambhe	
(tájjub)	ki	bāt	hai.

arabicText: قَالُوٓا۟ أَتَعْجَبِينَ مِنْ أَمْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ رَحْمَتُ ٱللَّهِ وَبَرَكَـٰتُهُۥ عَلَيْكُمْ أَهْلَ ٱلْبَيْتِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ حَمِيدٌۭ مَّجِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
The	 angels	 said,	 “Do	 you	 wonder	 at	 the	
command	of	Allah?	Allah’s	mercy	and	His	
blessings	 be	 upon	 you,	 O	 people	 of	 this	
house;	 indeed	 He	 only	 is	 Most	
Praiseworthy,	Most	Honourable.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Firishte	 bole	 kya	 Allāh	 ke	 kām	 ka	
achambhā	 (tájjub)	 karti	 ho	 Allāh	 ki	
raḥmat		aur	us	ki	barkateñ	tum	par	aey	us	
ke	 ghar	 wālo!	 be-shak	 woh	 hi	 sab	
khoobiyoñ		wāla	‘izzat		wāla.

arabicText: فَلَمَّا ذَهَبَ عَنْ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ٱلرَّوْعُ وَجَآءَتْهُ ٱلْبُشْرَىٰ يُجَـٰدِلُنَا فِى قَوْمِ لُوطٍ
englishTranslationText:
And	 when	 Ibrahim’s	 fear	 abated	 and	 the	
glad	 tidings	 reached	 him,	 he	 argued	with	
Us	regarding	the	people	of	Lut.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	Ibrāhim ka	khauf	zāil	 (door)	huā	
aur	usey	khush	khabri	mili	ham	se	qaume-Lūt		ke	bāre	meiñ	jhagadne	lagā

arabicText: إِنَّ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ لَحَلِيمٌ أَوَّٰهٌۭ مُّنِيبٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 Ibrahim	 is	 most	 forbearing,	 very	
soft	hearted,	penitent.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak Ibrāhim tahammul	 	 wāla	 bahut	
āaheñ	karne		wāla	ruju’	lāne		wāla	hai

arabicText: يَـٰٓإِبْرَٰهِيمُ أَعْرِضْ عَنْ هَـٰذَآ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ قَدْ جَآءَ أَمْرُ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَإِنَّهُمْ ءَاتِيهِمْ عَذَابٌ غَيْرُ مَرْدُودٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“O	 Ibrahim,	 turn	 away	 from	 this;	 indeed	
your	 Lord’s	 command	 has	 come;	 and	
indeed	 a	 punishment	 will	 come	 upon	
them,	which	will	not	be	averted.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Ibrāhim!	Is	 khayāl	meiñ	 na	 padh	 beshak	 tere	 rab	 ka	 ḥukm	 āa	 chuka	 aur	 beshak		un	par	‘aƶāb	āane		wāla	hai	ke	pherā	
na	jayegā

arabicText: وَلَمَّا جَآءَتْ رُسُلُنَا لُوطًۭا سِىٓءَ بِهِمْ وَضَاقَ بِهِمْ ذَرْعًۭا وَقَالَ هَـٰذَا يَوْمٌ عَصِيبٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Our	angels	came	to	Lut,	he	was	
distressed	for	them	and	was	disheartened	
due	 to	 them,	 and	 said,	 “This	 is	 a	 day	 of	
great	hardship.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 Lūt	 ke	 pās	 hamāre	 Firishte	 āye	
usey	un	ka	gham	aur	un	ke	sabab	dil	tang	
huā	aur	bolā	yeh	badi	sakhti	kā	din	hai

arabicText: وَجَآءَهُۥ قَوْمُهُۥ يُهْرَعُونَ إِلَيْهِ وَمِن قَبْلُ كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ ۚ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِى هُنَّ أَطْهَرُ لَكُمْ ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ فِى ضَيْفِىٓ ۖ أَلَيْسَ مِنكُمْ رَجُلٌۭ رَّشِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 his	 people	 came	 running	 towards	
him;	 and	 they	 were	 in	 the	 habit	 of	
committing	 evil	 deeds;	 he	 said,	 “O	 my	
people!	These	women	of	 the	 tribe	are	my	
daughters	*	- they	are	purer	for	you	- therefore	fear	Allah and	do	not	disgrace	me	in	the	midst	of	
my	guests;	is	there	not	even	a	single	righteous	man	among	you?”	(*	The	wives	of	those	people.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ke pās	us	ki	qaum	daudti	āayi	aur	
unheiñ	āge	hi	se	bure	kāmoñ	ki’aādat	padi	
thi	kahā	aey	qaum!	Yeh	meri	qaum		ki	betiyān	haiñ	yeh	tumhāre	liye	suthri	haiñ	to	Allāh	se	daro	
aur	mujhe	mere	mehmānoñ	meiñ	ruswā	na	karo	kya	tum	meiñ	ek	ādmi	bhi	nek	chalan	nahiñ?

arabicText: وَجَآءَهُۥ قَوْمُهُۥ يُهْرَعُونَ إِلَيْهِ وَمِن قَبْلُ كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ ۚ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِى هُنَّ أَطْهَرُ لَكُمْ ۖ فَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَلَا تُخْزُونِ فِى ضَيْفِىٓ ۖ أَلَيْسَ مِنكُمْ رَجُلٌۭ رَّشِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 his	 people	 came	 running	 towards	
him;	 and	 they	 were	 in	 the	 habit	 of	
committing	 evil	 deeds;	 he	 said,	 “O	 my	
people!	These	women	of	 the	 tribe	are	my	
daughters	*	- they	are	purer	for	you	- therefore	fear	Allah and	do	not	disgrace	me	in	the	midst	of	
my	guests;	is	there	not	even	a	single	righteous	man	among	you?”	(*	The	wives	of	those	people.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	ke pās	us	ki	qaum	daudti	āayi	aur	
unheiñ	āge	hi	se	bure	kāmoñ	ki’aādat	padi	
thi	kahā	aey	qaum!	Yeh	meri	qaum		ki	betiyān	haiñ	yeh	tumhāre	liye	suthri	haiñ	to	Allāh	se	daro	
aur	mujhe	mere	mehmānoñ	meiñ	ruswā	na	karo	kya	tum	meiñ	ek	ādmi	bhi	nek	chalan	nahiñ?

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ لَقَدْ عَلِمْتَ مَا لَنَا فِى بَنَاتِكَ مِنْ حَقٍّۢ وَإِنَّكَ لَتَعْلَمُ مَا نُرِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
. They	said,	“You	know	that	we	have	no	right	to	the	daughters	of	your	tribe;	and	you	obviously	
know	what	we	desire.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Bole	 tumheiñ	m’alooom	hai	ke	 tumhāri	qaum	ki	betiyoñ	meiñ	hamārā	koi	haq	nahiñ	aur	 tum	
zaroor	jānte	ho	jo	hamāri	khwahish	hai.

arabicText: قَالَ لَوْ أَنَّ لِى بِكُمْ قُوَّةً أَوْ ءَاوِىٓ إِلَىٰ رُكْنٍۢ شَدِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“If	only	I	had	the	strength	against	you	or	were	able	to	get	the	refuge	of	some	strong	support!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bolā	aey	kāsh	mujhe	tumhāre	muqābil	zor	hota	ya	kisi	mazboot	pāye	ki	panāh	letā

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰلُوطُ إِنَّا رُسُلُ رَبِّكَ لَن يَصِلُوٓا۟ إِلَيْكَ ۖ فَأَسْرِ بِأَهْلِكَ بِقِطْعٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتْ مِنكُمْ أَحَدٌ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَكَ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ مُصِيبُهَا مَآ أَصَابَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ مَوْعِدَهُمُ ٱلصُّبْحُ ۚ أَلَيْسَ ٱلصُّبْحُ بِقَرِيبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
The	angels	said,	“O	Lut!	We	are	the	sent	ones	of	your	Lord	- they	cannot	get	to	you,	therefore	
during	the	night	take	your	entire	household	with	you	- and	not	one	of	you	may	turn	around	and	
see	- except	 your	 wife;	 she	 too	 will	 be	 afflicted	 with	 the	 same	 as	 they	 will	 be;	 indeed	 their	
promise	is	at	morn;	is	not	the	morning	imminent?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Firishte	bole	aey	Lūt!	Ham	tumhāre	Rab	ke	bheje	huye	haiñ	woh	tum	tak	nahiñ	pahuñch	sakte	
to	apne	ghar	wāloñ	ko	rātoñ	rāt	le	jāo	aur	tum	meiñ	koi	peeth	pher	kar	na	dekhe	siwā-e	tumhāri	
áurat	ke	usey	bhi	wohi	pahuñchnā	hai	jo	inheiñ	pahuñche	gā	be-shak	in	ka	w’adā	subah	ke	waqt	
hai	kya	subah	qarib	nahiñ

arabicText: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ أَمْرُنَا جَعَلْنَا عَـٰلِيَهَا سَافِلَهَا وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا حِجَارَةًۭ مِّن سِجِّيلٍۢ مَّنضُودٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	when	Our	 command	 came,	We	 turned	
that	township	upside	down	and	showered	
it	continuously	with	stones	of	fired	clay.
romanUrduTranslationText:
So	phir	jab	hamārā	ḥukm	āayā	ham	ne	us	
basti	ke	ūpar	ko	us	ka	neechā	kar	diyā	aur	
us	par	kan-kar	ke	patthar	lagatār	barsāye

arabicText: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَمَا هِىَ مِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ بِبَعِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
That	 are	 marked,	 in	 the	 custody	 your	
Lord;	 and	 those	 stones	 are	 not	 at	 all	 far	
from	the	unjust!
romanUrduTranslationText:
So	phir	jab	hamārā	ḥukm	āayā	ham	ne	us	
basti	ke	ūpar	ko	us	ka	neechā	kar	diyā	aur	
us	par	kan-kar	ke	patthar	lagatār	barsāye

arabicText: ۞ وَإِلَىٰ مَدْيَنَ أَخَاهُمْ شُعَيْبًۭا ۚ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥ ۖ وَلَا تَنقُصُوا۟ ٱلْمِكْيَالَ وَٱلْمِيزَانَ ۚ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰكُم بِخَيْرٍۢ وَإِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍۢ مُّحِيطٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 to	 Madyan	 their	 fellow	 man	 Shuaib;	
he	 said,	 “O	 my	 people!	 Worship	 Allah -
there	 is	 no	 other	 True	 God	 except	 Him;	
and	 do	 not	 make	 reductions	 in	 measure	
and	weight	- indeed	I	see	you	prosperous,	
and	I	fear	the	punishment	of	the	Besieging	
Day	(of	Resurrection)	upon	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 Madyan	 ki	 taraf	 un	 ke	 ham qaum	
Sho’aib ko	kahā	aey	meri	qaum!		Allāh	ko	
poojo	 us	 ke	 siwā	 tumhārā	 koi	 m’abood	
nahiñ	 aur	 nāp	 aur	 tol	meiñ	 kami	 na	 karo	
be-shak	 maiñ	 tumheiñ	 āsooda	 hāl	
(māldār-o-khushāl)	 dekhtā	 hooñ aur	
mujhe	tum	par	gher	lene	wāle	din	ke	‘aƶāb	
ka	dar	hai

arabicText: وَيَـٰقَوْمِ أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْمِكْيَالَ وَٱلْمِيزَانَ بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۖ وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“O	my	 people!	Measure	 and	weigh	in	 full	
with	 justice,	 and	 do	 not	 give	 the	 people	
their	goods	 diminished,	and	 do	 not	 roam	
about	in	the	earth	causing	turmoil.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 aey	 meri	 qaum!	Nāp	 aur	 tol	 insāf	 ke	
sāth	poori	karo	aur	logoñ	ko	un	ki	chizen	
ghatā	 kar	 na	 do	 aur	 zameen	 meiñ	 fasād	
machāte	na	phiro

arabicText: بَقِيَّتُ ٱللَّهِ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ ۚ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ عَلَيْكُم بِحَفِيظٍۢ
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	 ka	 diyā	 jo	 bach	 rahe	 woh	 tumhāre	
liye	 behtar	 hai	 agar	 tumheiñ	 yaqeen	 ho	
aur	maiñ	kuch		tum	par	nigeh	bān	nahiñ

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰشُعَيْبُ أَصَلَوٰتُكَ تَأْمُرُكَ أَن نَّتْرُكَ مَا يَعْبُدُ ءَابَآؤُنَآ أَوْ أَن نَّفْعَلَ فِىٓ أَمْوَٰلِنَا مَا نَشَـٰٓؤُا۟ ۖ إِنَّكَ لَأَنتَ ٱلْحَلِيمُ ٱلرَّشِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “O	 Shuaib!	 Does	 your	 prayer	
command	you	that	we	 forsake	the	deities	
of	 our	 forefathers	 or	 that	we	may	 not	 do	
as	 we	 wish	 with	 our	 own	 property?	 Yes	
indeed	 - only	 you	 are	 very	 intelligent,	
most	 righteous.”	 .	 (They	 mocked	 at	 him	
with	sarcasm.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	 aey	 Sho’aib!	 kya	 tumhāri	 Namāz	
tumheiñ	yeh	ḥukm		deti	hai	ke	ham	apne	bāp	dādā	ke	khudāoñ	ko	chod	deñ	ya	apne	māl	meiñ	jo	
chāhen	na	kareñ?		Hāñ	ji	tumhiñ	bade	‘aqlmand nek	chalan	ho.

arabicText: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ أَرَءَيْتُمْ إِن كُنتُ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٍۢ مِّن رَّبِّى وَرَزَقَنِى مِنْهُ رِزْقًا حَسَنًۭا ۚ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُخَالِفَكُمْ إِلَىٰ مَآ أَنْهَىٰكُمْ عَنْهُ ۚ إِنْ أُرِيدُ إِلَّا ٱلْإِصْلَـٰحَ مَا ٱسْتَطَعْتُ ۚ وَمَا تَوْفِيقِىٓ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِ ۚ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَإِلَيْهِ أُنِيبُ
englishTranslationText:
. He said,	“O	my	people!	What	is	your	opinion	- if	I	am	on	a	clear	proof	from	my	Lord	and	He	has	
bestowed	me	with	an	excellent	sustenance	from	Him	(shall	I	ignore	all	this?);	and	the	matter	I	
forbid	you	to	do,	I	do	not	wish	that	I	myself	act	against	it;	I	only intend	to	make	improvements	
as	far	possible;	my	guidance	is	only	from	Allah;	I	rely	only	upon	Him	and	towards	Him	only	do	I	
incline.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	aey	meri	qaum!		Bhalā	batāo	to	agar	maiñ	apne	Rab	ki	taraf		se	roshan	daleel	par	hooñ	aur	
us	ne	mujhe	apne	pās	se	achchi	rozi	di	aur	maiñ	nahiñ	chāhtā	hooñ	ke	jis	bāt	se	tumheñ	man’a	
kartā	hooñ	āp	us	ka	khilāf	karne	lagooñ	maiñ	 to	jahāñ	 tak	bane	sañwārnā	hi	chāhtā	hooñ	aur	
meri	taufiq	Allāh	hi	ki	taraf		se	hai	maiñ	ne	usi	par	bharosa	kiya	aur	usi	ki	taraf		rujú hotā	hooñ

arabicText: وَيَـٰقَوْمِ لَا يَجْرِمَنَّكُمْ شِقَاقِىٓ أَن يُصِيبَكُم مِّثْلُ مَآ أَصَابَ قَوْمَ نُوحٍ أَوْ قَوْمَ هُودٍ أَوْ قَوْمَ صَـٰلِحٍۢ ۚ وَمَا قَوْمُ لُوطٍۢ مِّنكُم بِبَعِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 O	 my	 people!	 May	 not	 your	
opposition	 to	 me	 occasion	 the	 coming	
upon	 you	 of	 the	 thing	 similar	 to	 what	
befell	the	people	of	Nooh	or	the	people	of	
Hud	or	the	people	of	Saleh;	and	the	people	
of	Lut	are	not	at	all	far	from	you!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	meri	qaum!	Tumheñ meri	zid	yeh	
na	 kamwā	 de	 (burā	 kām	 karāde)	 ke	 tum	
par	pade	jo	padā	thā	Nūh ki	qaum	ya	Hood
ki	qaum	ya	Suāleh ki	qaum	par	aur	Lūt ki	
qaum	to	kuch tum	se	door	nahiñ

arabicText: وَٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ ثُمَّ تُوبُوٓا۟ إِلَيْهِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبِّى رَحِيمٌۭ وَدُودٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
. “Ask	forgiveness	from	your	Lord	and	then	
incline	 towards	 Him	 in	 repentance;	
indeed	 my	 Lord	 is	 Most	 Merciful,	 Most	
Affectionate.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 apne	 Rab	 se	 mu’āfi	 chāho	 phir	 us	 ki	
taraf ruju’	 lāo	 be-shak	 merā	 Rab	
maherbān	mahabbat wāla	hai

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰشُعَيْبُ مَا نَفْقَهُ كَثِيرًۭا مِّمَّا تَقُولُ وَإِنَّا لَنَرَىٰكَ فِينَا ضَعِيفًۭا ۖ وَلَوْلَا رَهْطُكَ لَرَجَمْنَـٰكَ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ عَلَيْنَا بِعَزِيزٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
They	 said,	 “O	 Shuaib!	 We	 do	 not	
understand	 most	 of	 what	 you	 say,	 and	
indeed	 we	 perceive	 you	 weak	 among	 us;	
were	 it	 not	 for	 your	 relatives,	 we	 would	
have	 stoned	 you;	 and	 in	 our	 sight,	 you	
have	no	respect	at	all.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bole	 aey	 Shu’aeb!	 Hamāri	 samajh	 meiñ	
nahiñ	āatiñ	tumhāri	bahut	si	bāteñ	aur	beshak	 	 ham	 tumheiñ	 apne	 meiñ	 kamzor	
dekhte	 haiñ	 aur	 agar	 tumhārā	 kunba	 na	
hotā	 to	 ham	 ne	 tumheñ	 pathrāo	 kar	 diyā	
hotā	aur	kuch	hamāri	nigāh	meiñ	tumheñ	
‘izzat	nahiñ

arabicText: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ أَرَهْطِىٓ أَعَزُّ عَلَيْكُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَٱتَّخَذْتُمُوهُ وَرَآءَكُمْ ظِهْرِيًّا ۖ إِنَّ رَبِّى بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ مُحِيطٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
He	 said,	 “O	 my	 people!	 Is	 the	 pressure	
upon	 you	 from	my	 relatives,	worth	more	
than	 Allah?	 And	 you	 put	 Him	 *	 behind	
your	backs;	indeed	whatever	you	do	is	all	
within	my	Lords’	control.”	(*	His	command	
/	my	preaching.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	 aey	 meri	 qaum!	 Kya	 tum	 par	 mere	
kunbe	 ka	 dabāo	 Allāh	 se	 ziyādah	 hai	 aur	
usey	 tum	 ne	 apni	 peeth	 piche	 dāl	 rakhā	
be-shak	 	jo	 kuch	 	 tum	 karte	 ho	 sab	mere	
Rab	ke	bas	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: وَيَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْمَلُوا۟ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِكُمْ إِنِّى عَـٰمِلٌۭ ۖ سَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ مَن يَأْتِيهِ عَذَابٌۭ يُخْزِيهِ وَمَنْ هُوَ كَـٰذِبٌۭ ۖ وَٱرْتَقِبُوٓا۟ إِنِّى مَعَكُمْ رَقِيبٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“And	 O	 my	 people!	 Keep	 on	 with	 your	
works	in	your	positions,	I	am	doing	mine;	
very	 soon	 you	 will	 come	 to	 know	- upon	
whom	 comes	 the	 punishment	 that	 will	
disgrace	him,	and	who	is	the	liar;	and	wait	
- I	too	am	waiting	with	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	qaum!	Tum	apni	jagah	apna	 kām	
kiye	 jāo	 maiñ	 apnā	 kām	 kartā	 hooñ	 ab	
jānā	(janna)	chāhte	ho	kis	par	ātā	hai	woh	
‘aƶāb	ke	usey	ruswā	kare	ga	aur	kaun	jhootā	hai	aur	intiżār	karo	maiñ	bhi	tumhāre	sāth	intiżār	
meiñ	hooñ	.

arabicText: وَلَمَّا جَآءَ أَمْرُنَا نَجَّيْنَا شُعَيْبًۭا وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَعَهُۥ بِرَحْمَةٍۢ مِّنَّا وَأَخَذَتِ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ ٱلصَّيْحَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ فِى دِيَـٰرِهِمْ جَـٰثِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	Our	command	came,	We	rescued	Shuaib	and	the	Muslims	who	were	with	him	by	Our	
mercy;	and	the	terrible	scream	seized	the	unjust	- so	at	morning	they	remained	lying	flattened	
in	their	homes.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jab	 Hamārā	 ḥukm	 āyā	 Ham	 ne	 Shu’aib aur	 us	 ke	 sāth	 ke	 Musalmānoñ	 ko	 apni	 Raḥmat				
farmā	kar	bachā	liyā	aur	zālimoñ	ko	chingādh	ne	āa	liya	to	subah	apne	gharoñ	meiñ	ghutnoñ	ke	
bal	pade	reh	gaye

arabicText: كَأَن لَّمْ يَغْنَوْا۟ فِيهَآ ۗ أَلَا بُعْدًۭا لِّمَدْيَنَ كَمَا بَعِدَتْ ثَمُودُ
englishTranslationText: . As	if	they	had	never	lived	there;	away	with	the	Madyan,	just	as	the	Thamud	were	removed	afar!
romanUrduTranslationText: Goyā	kabhi	wahāñ	base	hi	na	the	are	door	hoñ	Madyan	jaise	door	huye	Samood

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا مُوسَىٰ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَسُلْطَـٰنٍۢ مُّبِينٍ
englishTranslationText: And	indeed	We	sent	Moosa	with	Our	revelations	and	a	clear	domination.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	Ham	ne	Mūsā ko	apni	Āyatoñ	aur	sarih	ghalbe	ke	sāth.

arabicText: إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦ فَٱتَّبَعُوٓا۟ أَمْرَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۖ وَمَآ أَمْرُ فِرْعَوْنَ بِرَشِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Towards	Firaun	and	his	court	members,	thereupon	they	followed	the	commands	of	Firaun;	and	
the	work	of	Firaun	was not	proper.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Fir’aun	aur	us	ke	darbāriyoñ	ki	taraf		bhejā	to	woh	fir’aun	ke	kunbe	par	chale	aur	fir’aun	ka	kām	
rāsti	(durust-o-dayānatdāri)	ka	na	thā

arabicText: يَقْدُمُ قَوْمَهُۥ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ فَأَوْرَدَهُمُ ٱلنَّارَ ۖ وَبِئْسَ ٱلْوِرْدُ ٱلْمَوْرُودُ
englishTranslationText:
He	 will	 lead	 his	 people	 on	 the	 Day	 of	
Resurrection,	therefore	landing	them	into	
hell;	 and what	 a	 wretched	 place	 to	 land	
into!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apni	 qaum	 ke	āage	 hoga	Qayāmat	 ke	 din	
to	unheiñ	dozakh	meiñ	lā	utārega	aur	woh	
Kya	hi	burā	ghāt	utarne	ka.

arabicText: وَأُتْبِعُوا۟ فِى هَـٰذِهِۦ لَعْنَةًۭ وَيَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۚ بِئْسَ ٱلرِّفْدُ ٱلْمَرْفُودُ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 a	 curse	 followed	 them	 in	 the	 world,	
and	 on	 the	 Day	 of	 Resurrection;	 what	 a	
wretched	gift	is	what	they	received.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	peeche	padi	is	jahāñ	meiñ	l’anat	
aur	Qayāmat	 ke	 din	 kya	 hi	 burā	 ‘in’ām	jo	
unheiñ	milā.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآءِ ٱلْقُرَىٰ نَقُصُّهُۥ عَلَيْكَ ۖ مِنْهَا قَآئِمٌۭ وَحَصِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
These	 are	 the	 tidings	 of	 the	 townships,	
which	 We	 relate	 to	 you	 (O	 dear	 Prophet	
Muhammad - peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him)	- some	of	 them	still	stand	and	some	
are	cut	off.
romanUrduTranslationText:
yeh	 bastiyoñ	 ki	 khabreñ	 haiñ	 ke	 ham	
tumheñ	sunāte	haiñ	un	meiñ	koi	khadi	hai	
aur	koi	kat	gayi

arabicText: وَمَا ظَلَمْنَـٰهُمْ وَلَـٰكِن ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ ۖ فَمَآ أَغْنَتْ عَنْهُمْ ءَالِهَتُهُمُ ٱلَّتِى يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَىْءٍۢ لَّمَّا جَآءَ أَمْرُ رَبِّكَ ۖ وَمَا زَادُوهُمْ غَيْرَ تَتْبِيبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	did	not	oppress	them	at	all,	but	it	
is	 they	 who	 wronged	 themselves	 -
therefore	 their	 deities,	 whom	 they	
worshipped	 other	 than	 Allah,	 did	 not	 in	
the	 least	 benefit	 them	 when	 your	 Lord’s	
command	 came;	 and	 due	 to	 them,	 they	
increased	nothing	but	ruin.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 ham	 ne	 un	 par	 zulm	 na	 kiya	 balke	
khud	 unhoñ	 ne	 apnā	 burā	 kiya	 to	 un	 ke	
m’abood	jinheiñ	 Allāh	 ke	 siwā	 poojte	 the	
un	ke	kuchh		kām	na	āye	jab	tumhāre	rab	
ka	 ḥukm āyā	 aur	 un	 se	 unheiñ	 halāk	 ke	
siwā	kuch		na	badhā

arabicText: وَكَذَٰلِكَ أَخْذُ رَبِّكَ إِذَآ أَخَذَ ٱلْقُرَىٰ وَهِىَ ظَـٰلِمَةٌ ۚ إِنَّ أَخْذَهُۥٓ أَلِيمٌۭ شَدِيدٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	 similar	 is	 the	 seizure	 of	 your	 Lord	
when	He	seizes	 the	 townships	upon	 their	
injustice;	 indeed	 His	 seizure	 is	 painful,	
severe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 aisi	 hi	 pakad	 hai	 tere	 Rab	 ki	 jab	
bastiyoñ	 ko	 pakadtā	 hai	 un	 ke	 zulm	 par	
be-shak	 us	 ki	 pakad	 dard-nāk	 karri	
(Sakht) hai

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّمَنْ خَافَ عَذَابَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمٌۭ مَّجْمُوعٌۭ لَّهُ ٱلنَّاسُ وَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمٌۭ مَّشْهُودٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	 this	is	a	sign	 for	one	who	 fears	
the	 punishment	 of	 the	 Hereafter;	 this	 is	
the	 day	 on	 which	 everyone	 will	 be	
gathered,	 and	 this	 is	 the	 Day	 of	
Attendance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak is	 meiñ	 nishāni	 hai	 us	 ke	 liye	 jo	
āakhirat ke	 ‘aƶāb	 se	 dare	 woh	 din	 hai	 jis	
meiñ	 sab	log	ikatthe	 hoñ	 ge	 aur	 woh	 din	
haziri	kā	hai

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةًۭ لِّمَنْ خَافَ عَذَابَ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمٌۭ مَّجْمُوعٌۭ لَّهُ ٱلنَّاسُ وَذَٰلِكَ يَوْمٌۭ مَّشْهُودٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	 this	is	a	sign	 for	one	who	 fears	
the	 punishment	 of	 the	 Hereafter;	 this	 is	
the	 day	 on	 which	 everyone	 will	 be	
gathered,	 and	 this	 is	 the	 Day	 of	
Attendance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak is	 meiñ	 nishāni	 hai	 us	 ke	 liye	 jo	
āakhirat ke	 ‘aƶāb	 se	 dare	 woh	 din	 hai	 jis	
meiñ	 sab	log	ikatthe	 hoñ	 ge	 aur	 woh	 din	
haziri	kā	hai

arabicText: وَمَا نُؤَخِّرُهُۥٓ إِلَّا لِأَجَلٍۢ مَّعْدُودٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	We	do	not	postpone	it	except	for	a	fixed	term.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	usey	peeche	nahiñ	hatate	magar	ek	gini	hui	muddat	ke	liye

arabicText: يَوْمَ يَأْتِ لَا تَكَلَّمُ نَفْسٌ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِۦ ۚ فَمِنْهُمْ شَقِىٌّۭ وَسَعِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText: When	 that	 day	 comes,	 no	 one	will	 speak	without	His	 permission;	 so	 among	 them	 are	 the	illfated	and	the	fortunate.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	woh	din	āaye	ga	koi	be	Hukm-e-Khudā	bāt	na	karega	to	un	meiñ	koi	bad-bakht	hai	koi	khush	
naseeb

arabicText: فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ شَقُوا۟ فَفِى ٱلنَّارِ لَهُمْ فِيهَا زَفِيرٌۭ وَشَهِيقٌ
englishTranslationText: So	those	who	are	ill-fated,	are	in	the	fire	- they	will	bray	like	donkeys	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	 woh	 jo	 bad-bakht	 haiñ	 woh	 to	 dozakh	 meiñ	 haiñ	 woh	 us	 meiñ	 gadhe	 ki	 tarah	 reñkeñ	
(Cheekhe	chillāyeñ)	ge

arabicText: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا مَا دَامَتِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ رَبُّكَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ فَعَّالٌۭ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
Remaining	in	it	as	long	as	the	heavens	and	the	earth	remain,	except	as	much	as	your	Lord	willed	
*;	indeed	your	Lord	may	do	whatever,	whenever,	He	wills.	(*	Remaining	forever	even	after	the	
heavens	and	the	earth	are	destroyed.)
romanUrduTranslationText: . Woh	us	meiñ	raheñ	ge	jab	 tak	āsmān-o-zameen	raheñ	magar	jitnā	 tumhāre	Rab	ne	chāhā	beshak tumhārā	Rab	jab	jo	chāhe	ka

arabicText: ۞ وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ سُعِدُوا۟ فَفِى ٱلْجَنَّةِ خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا مَا دَامَتِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتُ وَٱلْأَرْضُ إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ رَبُّكَ ۖ عَطَآءً غَيْرَ مَجْذُوذٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	those	who	are	fortunate	are	in	Paradise	- abiding	in	it	as	long	as	the	heavens	and	the	earth	
remain,	except	as	much	as	your	Lord	willed;	this	is	the	everlasting	favour.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh	jo	khush	naseeb	huye	woh	Jannat	meiñ	haiñ	hameshā	us	meiñ	raheñ	ge	jab	tak	āsmāno-zameen	raheñ	magar	jitnā	tumhāre	rab	ne	chahā	yeh	bakhshish	hai	ke	kabhi	k

arabicText: فَلَا تَكُ فِى مِرْيَةٍۢ مِّمَّا يَعْبُدُ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ۚ مَا يَعْبُدُونَ إِلَّا كَمَا يَعْبُدُ ءَابَآؤُهُم مِّن قَبْلُ ۚ وَإِنَّا لَمُوَفُّوهُمْ نَصِيبَهُمْ غَيْرَ مَنقُوصٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	O	listener	(followers	of	this	Prophet),	do	
not	 fall	 into	 doubt	 by	 what	 these	
disbelievers	 worship;	 they	 only	 worship	
just	 as	 their	 forefathers	 worshipped	
before;	 and	 indeed	 we	 shall	 pay	 them	
their	due	in	full,	undiminished
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	aey	sun	ne	wāle!	Tu	dhoke	meiñ	na	pad	
us	 se	jise	 yeh	 kāfir	poojte	haiñ	 yeh	waisā	
hi	 poojte	 haiñ	 jaisā	 pehle	 in	 ke	 bāp	 dādā	
poojte the	be-shak		ham	in	ka	hissa	inheiñ	
poorā	bhar	deñ	ge	jis	meiñ	kami	na	hogi

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ فَٱخْتُلِفَ فِيهِ ۚ وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌۭ سَبَقَتْ مِن رَّبِّكَ لَقُضِىَ بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ وَإِنَّهُمْ لَفِى شَكٍّۢ مِّنْهُ مُرِيبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 We	 gave	 Moosa	 the	 Book,	
hence	there	was	discord	regarding	it;	and	
were	 it	 not	 for	 a	 Word	 that	 had	 been	
previously	 passed	 from	 your	 Lord,	 the	
matter	 would	 have	 immediately	 been	
decided	 regarding	 them;	and	indeed	 they	
are	in	an	intriguing	doubt	concerning	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Be-shak ham	 ne	 Mūsā ko	 kitāb	 di	 to	 us	
meiñ	phoot	pad	gayi	agar	tumhāre	Rab	ki	
ek	 bāt	 pehle	 na	 ho	 chuki	 hoti	 to	jabhi	 un	
ka	faislā	kar	diya	jāta	aur	be-shak		woh	us	
ki	taraf		dhokā dālne	wāle	shak	meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: وَإِنَّ كُلًّۭا لَّمَّا لَيُوَفِّيَنَّهُمْ رَبُّكَ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 indeed	 to	 each	 and	 every	 one,	 your	
Lord	 will	 fully	 repay	 his	 deeds;	 He	 is	
Informed	of	their	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 be-shak	 jitne	 haiñ	 ek-ek	 ko	 tumhārā	
Rab	us	ka	‘amal	poorā	bhar	degā	usey	un	
ke	kamoñ	ki	khabar	hai
